channel.title: Home on A minimal Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Home on A minimal Hugo website

item.title: Signals from the gut microbiota to distant organs in physiology and disease
item.description: Signals from the gut microbiota to distant organs in physiology and disease Gut microbiota convert environmental signals and dietary molecules into signaling metabolites to communicate with the host (Contreras et al., 2016). Reference Contreras, A.V., Cocom-Chan, B., Hernandez-Montes, G., Portillo-Bobadilla, T., and Resendis-Antonio, O. (2016). Host-microbiome interaction and cancer: Potential application in precision medicine. Frontiers in Physiology 7, 1â€“23.

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: About Hugo XMin
item.description: XMin is the first Hugo theme I have designed. The original reason that I wrote it was I needed a minimal example of Hugo themes when I was writing the blogdown book. Basically I wanted a simple theme that supports a navigation menu, a home page, other single pages, lists of pages, blog posts, categories, tags, and RSS. That is all. Nothing fancy. In terms of CSS and JavaScript, I really want to keep them minimal.
